case_title: P. C. DWADESH SHRENI & Co. LTD. vs INCOME-TAX OFFICER, A-WARD, ALIGARH
appellant: P. C. Dawadesh Shreni & Company Limited

accussed_details.name: P. C. Dawadesh Shreni & Company Limited
allegation: Non-payment of advance income-tax under Section 18-A of the Income-tax Act, 1922

complaint_summary: The Income-tax Officer demanded advance payment of income-tax under Section 18-A of the Income-tax Act, 1922, which the appellant failed to pay, claiming entitlement to a refund exceeding the demand.
investigation_summary: The Income-tax Department determined Rs. 4,805 as interest payable due to default in payment of advance income-tax. The appellant's appeal was dismissed by the Appellate Assistant Commissioner and later affirmed by the Tribunal.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the special appeal, ruling that interest under Section 18-A(8) was payable on the unpaid balance of advance income-tax. The court clarified that partial non-payment constitutes non-payment under the statute and that no separate order for awarding interest is required.
punishment: Payment of Rs. 4,805 as interest under Section 18-A(8) of the Income-tax Act, 1922.
legal_arguments: Interpretation of Section 18-A(8) regarding liability for interest on unpaid advance income-tax.
Requirement of a separate order for awarding interest under Section 18-A(8).
key_issues: Liability for interest on unpaid advance income-tax.
Interpretation of statutory provisions under Section 18-A of the Income-tax Act, 1922.

maxims.ut res valeat potius quam pereat: The machinery of calculation should be interpreted to make it workable.

legal_terms.Advance Payment of Tax: Payment required under Section 18-A of the Income-tax Act, 1922.
legal_terms.Interest Liability: Charge imposed for non-payment of advance tax.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the interpretation of Section 18-A(8) of the Income-tax Act, 1922, concerning interest liability for unpaid advance tax. The court clarified that partial non-payment constitutes non-payment under the statute and upheld the interest charge without requiring a separate order.
